column4: Could someone help me out?  All the icons in OpenOffice have been replaced by text
That happens if you uninstall the human theme for openoffice. Confirm that you still have it installed.
how do I do that?
Copy and paste this in a terminal:    sudo aptitude show openoffice.org-style-human  | grep State
The terminal says "Status:  installed"
Ok... well, maybe something simpler then. Open up openoffice.
Alright
then go >tools >options >view and make sure that under Menu there is a checkmark in the box that says show icons
You mean, the box labelled "Show Icons in Menus" is checked?  I don't see any other "Show Icons" box?
Yes, it's checked
ok, then this is probably the ubuntu bug about openoffice...
it's just about making sure you have the right theme installed I think...  try this...
what's the output of this: sudo aptitude show human-theme human-icon-theme | grep State
It says everything's installed

Sorry. That was my best guess. At least, that's what the problem was when I had problems. Remember where you were when you checked for the icons in menu? Try changing those icons to something else. There's default. Human. Chrystal. Try changing it then restarting writer. Failing that, all I can think is to try reinstalling office.
Tried and failed.  I'll try reinstalling Office after I'm done using it.  Thanks for the help!
wait
what might be easier, at least, if you're going to reinstall, is to try this first.
sudo aptitude install openoffice.org-style-*
I installed the tango theme through that way and everything works now!  Thank you!
cheers
